messages: 8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (21:32): starts implementing some sort of cache for /irc-logs/
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (21:50): sending gzipped .oga is a bad idea in general
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (21:50): I expect you won't get useful extra compression, everyone will do extra work, and you won't be able to seek
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:52): I'm just surprised that it seems to make it stop working entirely
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:52): whereas gzipped MP3s work fine
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:52): in Chrome
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (21:52): sure, that's probably a bug
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (21:54): can't say I blame them; if we have such a bug in Firefox, I wouldn't prioritize it
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:00): has a thereifixedit.com moment with the irc logs
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:02): For those who want to know, URLs from 2006-2009 are now cached once they are loaded, which speeds up requests afterwards
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:02): http:/ 8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083hoetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20090331 for example
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:02): Flagging of lines is disabled for cached files
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:04): also highlighting?
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:04): Flagging is highlighting
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:04): Flagged lines are still flagged
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:04): cookie-based highlighting
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:05): You just can't flag any new lines
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:05): Good point
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:05): might make sense to implement that client-side regardless
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:05): Now the cached files include who requested it, nice
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:06): Is the nick highlighting thing even useful in older files?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:07): why wouldn't it be?
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:07): I don't know, I never use it :)
73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (22:08): suggests scrapping it altogether; people with big egos can use greasemonkey
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:08): Or just a user stylesheet
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:09): The only thing the cookie thing does is add some extra css
73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (22:09): how would USS work without bloating the page with classes?
73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (22:09): nvm, offtopic from caching
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:10): Ah, it's not only CSS
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:13): 8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083, it highlights lines of people addressing you; it's useful when you weren't available or connected
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:13): Ow, wow, the nicks database contains 16000 records
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:13): Fu spammers!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:14): nog een rede voor client-side :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:14): je zou met localStorage kunnen gaan spelen
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:14): kan ik ook voor html5.org gaan doen
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:15): Of het probleem verplaatsen
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:15): Waardoor het een heel stuk simpeler wordt
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:15): nicks db droppen

8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:15): <li id="l-29" _a="Hixie" _r="christ"><a href="#l-29">#</a> [00:21] &lt;Hixie&gt; christ, i have a two-line testcase for mutation events and three browsers and they ALL DO SOMETHING DIFFERENT <span> </span></li>

8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:16): <li id="l-54" _a=&quot edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e3" _r="true"><a href="#l-54">#</a> [00:57] &lt edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e3&gt; true, I rather not bug him about ES gossip though :) <span> </span></li>
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:16): Okay, not that great
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:16): But great enough
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:16): dat kan ook nog, maar is het niet simpeler om zoiets met JS te doen?
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:18): Dat kan nu dus
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:18): Of ja, kan sowieso
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:18): Nu kan een user stylesheet iig ook
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:19): Or something
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:19): _a is Author
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:24): I mean, There, I fixed it
73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (22:27): does the nick highlight instruction have to be so urgent-looking?
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:27): Nope, removed
73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (22:30): there's no CSS like text-transform: sentence-case, eh?
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:36): Hmm, only one problem
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:36): If people load an old log, it is immediately cached
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:37): So the flagging of lines doesn't work anyway..
73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (22:37): 8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083: s/Options/Highlight/
73cc301f328d92a18944f8e1a0d91e72 (22:37): I thought you don't want to change old line flagging
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:40): Nog flagging possibilities in 2009 and earlier
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:40): What a shame
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:41): If each class had an id, the flagging could be done purely css without having to change the cached html
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:41): And then constantly include a new CSS file?
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:42): There are 15000 flagged lines.. You guys have to start typing less interesting stuff!
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:44): Is it still running on your sewing machine?
8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (22:44): It is in a clothing shop, so that does make sense :)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:48): Maybe we could upgrade to a 286 or something
